FREN 488W African Orality and Political Rebellion
(cross-listed with FREN 488W 1 / S. Xavier TTh 11:30am-12:45pm).
Content: This course will examine oral African texts in French or French translation, from Wolof, Malinké, Kikongo and Lingala among other African languages, to study traditional storytelling, the politics of transmission and African philosophy. Together, we will consider how orality can be a vehicle of cultural protest and political rebellion while building solidarities across peoples and places. Texts studied will include short stories, poems, songs, a musical play, and long form narratives (literature and film) that rely on oral language structures.
Particulars: This course will be taught in French.
